edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class SaveIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.SaveIO

  • public class SaveIO
extends java.lang.Object
    The SaveIO class represents an object which will be able to save and load the game to and from a .dat file. The load(String) method will assemble the serialized objects into an array and return it. The save(String, Entity[]) method, similarly, will take an array and serialize all objects within. Both will be in the same order, so the saved and loaded data will be compatible.
    Author:
    Aidan Novobilski

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public Entity[] load(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method will establish and interpret an input stream from a file. It will load serialized objects from the name/location as specified by the file name, create them, and place them into an array to be returned to the GameEngine, and then close the stream.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name/location of the file to be loaded.
        Returns:
        Returns the array of entities stored within the file.

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String fileName,
                 Entity[] entities)
        This method will establish and interpret an output stream to a file. It will serialize objects in the taken array and write them to a binary file with the name/location specified by the file name, and then write them to the binary file. Afterwards it will close the stream.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name/location of the file to be saved.
        entities - The array of Entity to be saved.
